pageContext.description: A copper alloy cast arrowhead or very small spearhead, probably dating to the late bronze age period, probably the Penard or Ewart Park phase, about 1300 BC - 800 BC. The arrowhead is socketed and leaf shaped with a central ridge running down the length. The ridge is circular in section. Most of the socket is missing. The projectile has a dark brown patina, missing in places on the ridge, and with small areas of bright green corrosion. Compare SWYOR-19E2B1 and SF9209, and also compare pegged leaf shaped spear heads.
pageContext.notes: The finder listed on this record purchased the object from another detectorist.
